questions.question: The long transmission line is modelled as

explanations.a: Impedance model is not followed for long transmission line.
explanations.b: Nominal pi model is not followed for long transmission line.
explanations.c: Nominal T model is not followed for long transmission line.
explanations.d: Distributed parameter model is followed for long transmission line.

questions.question: The length of long transmission line (50 Hz power supply) is typically

explanations.a: Line length less than 100km is not considered as a long transmission line.
explanations.b: The classification of transmission line according to line length more than 250 km is selected for long transmission line.
explanations.c: Line length between 100km to 250km is not considered as a long transmission line.
explanations.d: Line length between 150km to 250km is not considered as a long transmission line.

questions.question: The following transmission line is called symmetrical lossless line

answers.a: The voltages sent and received are the equal, regulated with neglected line resistance
answers.b: The voltages sent and received are the different with neglected line resistance
answers.c: The voltages sent and received are the 1 per unit with neglected line resistance
answers.d: The voltages sent and received are the equal, regulated with neglected line reactance

explanations.a: According to the definition, maintaining Sending end and receiving end voltages are 1 per unit with neglecting line resistance called symmetrical lossless line. Since the line resistance is neglected it is added and called as lossless line.
explanations.b: According to the definition, maintaining Sending end and receiving end voltages are 1 per unit with neglecting line resistance called symmetrical lossless line. Since the line resistance is neglected it is added and called as lossless line.
explanations.c: According to the definition, maintaining Sending end and receiving end voltages are 1 per unit with neglecting line resistance called symmetrical lossless line. Since the line resistance is neglected it is added and called as lossless line.
explanations.d: According to the definition, maintaining Sending end and receiving end voltages are 1 per unit with neglecting line resistance called symmetrical lossless line. Since the line resistance is neglected it is added and called as lossless line.

questions.question: Under no load condition, the relative voltage angular difference between two buses in power system practically _________ degree.

explanations.a: Voltage angle differences decide the real power flow between two buses. If the voltage angle differences is zero. Then sin(0) is zero.
explanations.b: Voltage angle differences decide the real power flow between two buses. If the voltage angle differences is zero. Then sin(0) is zero.
explanations.c: Voltage angle differences decide the real power flow between two buses. If the voltage angle differences is zero. Then sin(0) is zero.
explanations.d: Voltage angle differences decide the real power flow between two buses. If the voltage angle differences is zero. Then sin(0) is zero.

questions.question: In a long transmission line, the real power flow between two buses mainly depends on

answers.a: Difference between the RMS Voltage angles of two buses
answers.b: Difference between the current angles of incoming and outgoing buses
answers.c: The impedance angles of transmission line
answers.d: Difference between the apparent power angles of two buses

explanations.a: According the power flow between two buses, it is found that to control the real power flow, voltage angle of the two buses are need to be adjusted. Refer more reference [4].
explanations.b: According the power flow between two buses, it is found that to control the real power flow, voltage angle of the two buses are need to be adjusted. Refer more reference [4].
explanations.c: According the power flow between two buses, it is found that to control the real power flow, voltage angle of the two buses are need to be adjusted. Refer more reference [4].
explanations.d: According the power flow between two buses, it is found that to control the real power flow, voltage angle of the two buses are need to be adjusted. Refer more reference [4].

questions.question: In a long transmission line, the reactive power flow between two buses mainly depends on

answers.a: Difference between the RMS Voltage angles of two buses
answers.b: difference between the voltage magnitude of the two buses
answers.c: The impedance angles of transmission line
answers.d: Difference between the apparent power angles of two buses

explanations.a: According the power flow between two buses, it is found that to control the reactive power flow, voltage magnitude of the two buses are need to be adjusted. Refer more reference [4].
